ca.mcgill.ecse211.navigation

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.navigation.Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to move the robot and includes various methods to make controlling the wheel motors easier. By default, the forward and rotational speed are set to 250 and 120 respectively.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Driver(Odometer odometer, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor, double wheelRadius, double baseWidth)
      This creates a Driver instance for the robot

    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver

        public Driver(Odometer odometer,
              EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
              EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
              double wheelRadius,
              double baseWidth)
        This creates a Driver instance for the robot
        Parameters:
        odometer - an Odometer instance which is the robot's odometer
        leftMotor - a leftMotor instance which is the robot's left motor
        rightMotor - a rightMotor instance which is the robot's right motor
        wheelRadius - a double which is the radius of the robot's wheel
        baseWidth - a double which is the width of the robot's base (i.e.: the distance between its two wheels)

        y - a double which is the y axis location (in cm)

      • forward

        public void forward(double distance,
                    boolean immediateReturn)
        Method to move the robot forward by a set distance
        Parameters:
        distance - a double which is the distance by which the robot is to be moved forward (in cm)

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Method to turn the robot to an certain orientation
        Parameters:
        theta - a double which is the target orientation

      • turnBy

        public void turnBy(double theta,
                   boolean immediateReturn)
        Method to turn the robot by a certain angle
        Parameters:
        theta - a double which is the angle by which the robot is to be turned
        immediateReturn - a boolean which is a flag that indicates if the method should wait for the robot to be done turning before returning
